alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 6:22PM MST until September 01 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST/8 PM PDT/ THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE AND SAN BERNARDINO COUNTIES... At 622 PM MST /622 PM PDT/, local law enforcement reported flash flooding on US-95 at mile marker 66. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Topock, Needles, Highway 95, Mojave Ranch Estates, Mohave Valley, Arizona Village, Mesquite Creek and Willow Valley. This includes the following roads... State Route 95 in Mohave County between mile markers 228 and 238. Highway 95 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 45 and 80. Oatman Highway between mile markers 1 and 23. This includes the following streams and drainages... Topock Bay, Colorado River, Sacramento Wash, Warm Springs Wash and Fivemile Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
